snippet.title: Three feared dead after US military 'mishap'
snippet.content:
THREE people are missing feared dead, and up to 20 have been rescued, some with serious injuries, after a US military aircraft went down off Rockhampton tonight. The helicopter - an MV-22 Osprey tiltrotor helicopter, which can operate from aircraft carriers - was in Australia as part of the giant Australian-US military exercise Talisman Sabre, which has just concluded in Queensland. It is understood the aircraft crashed off the coast of Shoalwater Bay near Rockhampton in central North Queensland in the late afternoon.
Just in: Marine Corps announces search and rescue underway off Australia after MV-22 mishap. Small boats and warships searching
Military sources said the accident happened as the aircraft attempted to land on the USS Ronald Reagan. It is understood 23 of the 26 personnel on board had been accounted for. A search and rescue effort was under way last night, with boats and warships searching for the missing personnel.
The USS Ronald Reagan will dock in Brisbane on Sunday and give its crew a chance to explore the Qld capital.
USS Ronald Reagan docks in Brisbane Four Bell-Boeing MV-22 Osprey aircraft were in Australia from US Marine Medium Tiltrotor Squadron 268, landing in Darwin at the end of April. Sources told The Sunday Mail one seriously injured marine was being transported to Rockhampton Hospital last night.
US Marine aircraft crashes off Australia, search and rescue effort underway. CREDIT: FOX News
US Marine aircraft crashes off Australia, search and rescue effort underway There are no Australians involved. Last night the Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull was travelling back from Western Australia but his office had been briefed on the incident. It's understood most of those rescued had serious injuries. The strange-looking aircraft, resembling a cross between a helicopter and airplane, has capabilities including taking off vertically and travelling much faster than a helicopter. In a statement tonight, the US Military said: "The United States Marine Corps confirms there is an active search and rescue operation ongoing for service members involved in an MV-22 mishap off the east coast of Australia. Ship's small boats and aircraft from the 31st Marine Expeditionary Unit and Bonhomme Richard Expeditionary Strike Group are conducting the search and rescue operations. We will provide more details as they become available.'' Originally published as
